oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Traveling trunk of Cpl. Samuel Cantrell
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Made in the north, this white pine trunk still has original paper within. Family history holds that Cpl. Cantrell returned home from the Civil War with this trunk. Cantrell enlisted as a private in Co. C, 23rd Tenn. Inf., CSA. He was promoted to corporal in September 1863 and served the entire war. Captured at Hatchers Run on April 2, 1865, he gave his oath of allegiance on June 19, 1865 in Richmond, Virginia.
